title: Corner Protest
description: Join us for the Corner Protest every Tuesday and Thursday at the SW Corner of Drake and College in Fort Collins. We aim to engage positively and express collective concerns like protecting democracy.
meeting_location: SW Corner of Drake and College
raw_text:
Join the Corner Protest every Tuesday and Thursday 4:15-5:45 PM
SW Corner of Drake and College in Fort Collins
Positive engagement
PROTECT DEMOCRACY
OMG GOP WTF
Right or Left … we all know this is WRONG!
WE THE PEOPLE
Thursday, October 30, 2025
4:15 - 5:45 pm
2601 S College Ave, Fort Collins, CO
raw_summary: The flyer is for the Corner Protest held every Tuesday and Thursday from 4:15 PM to 5:45 PM at the SW Corner of Drake and College in Fort Collins. It emphasizes positive engagement and includes slogans like 'PROTECT DEMOCRACY' and 'WE THE PEOPLE'. An upcoming event is scheduled for Thursday, October 30, 2025, at 2601 S College Ave, Fort Collins, CO.

title: Community Action at Home Depot
description: Join us for a community protest to oppose Home Depot's perceived support of ICE operations. Stand with us to protect our communities from fear and oppression.
raw_text:
COMMUNITY ACTION

ICE OUT OF
THE HOME DEPOT
PROTECT OUR COMMUNITIES!

To REGISTER
(QR code image)

ICE OUT OF
THE HOME DEPOT
PROTECT OUR COMMUNITIES!

With its silence and inaction, Home Depot has
become ICE's passive partner. With every new raid,
Home Depot is helping ICE meet its arrest quotas,
fill private prisons, and spread fear in our
communities. JOIN US on the public sidewalks.

Sat. November 1st
10am - 1pm
HOME DEPOT (south)
4502 John F Kennedy Pkwy
Fort Collins, CO 80525

This event is committed to nonviolence. Participants are expected to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation.
raw_summary: The image is a flyer for a community action event at Home Depot in Fort Collins, CO, opposing Home Depot's perceived support of ICE operations. The event is scheduled for November 1st from 10 AM to 1 PM. Attendees are encouraged to register and are reminded to maintain nonviolence during the protest.

title: Skills for Disagreeing Better Workshop
description: A free Braver Angels in-person event focused on developing communication skills to improve understanding across political divides.
sponsors: The League of Women Voters Ames & Story County
raw_text: Let's learn to disagree better, TOGETHER.  Join us for a FREE workshop in Ames!  Feeling tired of the constant political division?  What if we could build the skills to communicate across our differences with respect and clarity?  This FREE in-person workshop is a Braver Angels event designed to do just that.  “Skills for Disagreeing Better” is about learning practical skills to listen so others feel heard, and to share your own views in a way that others can hear.  WHEN: Sunday, November 2nd, 2 - 4 PM CST  WHERE: Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave., Ames  COST: FREE (Donations welcome)  Scan the code below to register! Use promo code "BRAVER" and select "Free Ticket" at checkout to reserve your spot.  HOSTED BY  Ames Public Library  Indivisible Ames  The League of Women Voters Ames & Story County  Democracy Every Day  Ames Area Religious Leaders Association (AARLA)
raw_summary: The image is an invitation to a free workshop called "Skills for Disagreeing Better" hosted by Braver Angels. It's aimed at teaching communication skills for navigating political divisions. The event is scheduled for November 2nd at Ames Public Library, in Ames, Iowa. The event is hosted by multiple organizations including the Ames Public Library and Indivisible Ames.

title: Veterans Day Overpass Bannering
description: Join us for an overpass bannering event on Veterans Day to stand with veterans in defending our constitution, streets, and oaths. The event involves displaying banners reading 'No Oath to Trump' on various overpasses in the Olympia-Lacey-Tumwater area.
raw_text: VETERANS 11.11 DAY 2025 NO OATH TO TRUMP 10 AM – 1 PM JOIN US!! OLYMPIA-LACEY-TUMWATER OVERPASS BANNERING 1 TUMWATER PEDESTRIAN BRIDGE / I-5 2 CUSTER WAY / I-5 3 CAPITOL BLVD BRIDGE / I-5 4 EASTSIDE ST. / I-5 5 BOULEVARD RD SE / I-5 6 CHEHALIS-WESTERN TRAIL BRIDGE / I-5 7 SLEATER-KINNEY AVE / I-5 BANNER WITH VETERANS ON HIGHWAY OVERPASSES FROM SEA TO SHINING SEA, STAND WITH VETERANS TO DEFEND OUR CONSTITUTION, OUR STREETS, AND OUR OATHS #NOOATHTOTRUMP #OURSTREETS #VETSAGAINSTTRUMP 501 INDIVISIBLE BACKBONE CAMPAIGN VISIBILITY BRIGADE
raw_summary: The image promotes an overpass bannering event on Veterans Day, November 11, 2025, from 10 AM to 1 PM. It involves banner displays at several overpass locations in the Olympia-Lacey-Tumwater area, with messages opposing taking an oath to Trump. Sponsors include Indivisible, Backbone Campaign, and Visibility Brigade. The flyer emphasizes standing with veterans to defend constitutional values.

title: Resistance Art Show
description: Join us for the opening of the Resistance Art Show — where creativity meets civic power. This event celebrates how the First Amendment protects our right to dissent, protest injustice, and imagine a freer world. Experience art that speaks truth to power — and help us plan our next bold act of public resistance.
raw_text:
RESISTANCE ART SHOW
OPENING: SUN, NOV 16, 7 - 9 PM

Join us for the opening of the Resistance Art Show — where creativity meets civic power. This event celebrates how the First Amendment protects our right to dissent, protest injustice, and imagine a freer world. Experience art that speaks truth to power — and help us plan our next bold act of public resistance.

YANT ART SPACE
72-50 AUSTIN STREET
FOREST HILLS NY 11375

QUEENS SAYS NO KINGS
raw_summary: The image is promoting an art show opening titled "Resistance Art Show," occurring on November 16 from 7 to 9 PM. It discusses themes of civic power and protest art, and the location is Yant Art Space, Forest Hills, NY.
